question: If one lunar orbit takes one month and a month has about 27 to 31 days, about how many days does the Moon take to orbit Earth?

content.source_1: The Moon’s mean distance from Earth is about 384,400 kilometers.
content.source_2: The Moon’s mean orbital speed around Earth is about 1.022 kilometers per second.
content.source_3: For near-circular motion, the orbital period T equals 2πr divided by the orbital speed v.
content.source_5: The interval between successive new moons (the lunar phase cycle) averages about 29.53 Earth days.
content.source_6: As the Moon travels around Earth, its changing angle relative to the Sun produces the repeating sequence of lunar phases (new, first quarter, full, last quarter, new).
